connector_type.name: Debezium MongoDB Connector
connector_type.description: Tracks a MongoDB replica set or a MongoDB sharded cluster for document changes in databases and collections, recording those changes as events.

topic.prefix.title: Topic prefix
topic.prefix.description: Topic prefix that identifies and provides a namespace for the particular database server/cluster is capturing changes. The topic prefix should be unique across all other connectors, since it is used as a prefix for all Kafka topic names that receive events emitted by this connector. Only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, dots and underscores must be accepted.

mongodb.hosts.title: Hosts
mongodb.hosts.description: The hostname and port pairs (in the form 'host' or 'host:port') of the MongoDB server(s) in the replica set.

mongodb.user.title: User
mongodb.user.description: Database user for connecting to MongoDB, if necessary.

mongodb.password.title: Password
mongodb.password.description: Password to be used when connecting to MongoDB, if necessary.

oneOf.description: Password of the database user to be used when connecting to the database.
An opaque reference to the password.

mongodb.ssl.enabled.title: Enable SSL connection to MongoDB
mongodb.ssl.enabled.description: Should connector use SSL to connect to MongoDB instances

database.include.list.title: Include Databases
database.include.list.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the database names for which changes are to be captured

database.exclude.list.title: Exclude Databases
database.exclude.list.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the database names for which changes are to be excluded

collection.include.list.title: Include Collections
collection.include.list.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the collection names for which changes are to be captured

collection.exclude.list.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the collection names for which changes are to be excluded

field.exclude.list.title: Exclude Fields
field.exclude.list.description: A comma-separated list of the fully-qualified names of fields that should be excluded from change event message values

snapshot.mode.title: Snapshot mode
snapshot.mode.description: The criteria for running a snapshot upon startup of the connector. Options include: 'initial' (the default) to specify the connector should always perform an initial sync when required; 'never' to specify the connector should never perform an initial sync

query.fetch.size.title: Query fetch size
query.fetch.size.description: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while streaming. A value of '0' uses the default JDBC fetch size.

max.batch.size.title: Change event batch size
max.batch.size.description: Maximum size of each batch of source records. Defaults to 2048.

max.queue.size.title: Change event buffer size
max.queue.size.description: Maximum size of the queue for change events read from the database log but not yet recorded or forwarded. Defaults to 8192, and should always be larger than the maximum batch size.

key.title: Kafka Message Key Format
key.description: The serialization format for the Kafka message key.

value.title: Kafka Message Value Format
value.description: The serialization format for the Kafka message value.

oneOf.title: Cast Kafka message key or value
oneOf.description: Cast an entire Kafka message key or value to another data type.

cast_to.title: Target data type
cast_to.description: The target data type to cast to.

oneOf.title: Cast payload fields
oneOf.description: Cast specific field(s) in a Kafka message key or value to another data type.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A list of the field names and their target data type of the fields that you want to cast.

field_name.title: Field name
field_name.description: The name of the field in the payload whose value you want to cast to another data type.

cast_to.title: Target type
cast_to.description: The target data type to cast to.

oneOf.title: Cast payload fields
oneOf.description: Cast specific field(s) in a Kafka message key or value to another data type.

oneOf.title: Insert Kafka metadata field
oneOf.description: Insert a field into the payload. For the field's value, select a Kafka record metadata type: topic name, partition number, or message timestamp.

kafka_value.title: Kafka record metadata type
kafka_value.description: Select the Kafka record metadata (topic name, partition number, or message timestamp) to use for the value of the inserted field.

oneOf.title: Filter or rename fields
oneOf.description: Filter out (excludes) or pass (includes) only the specified fields in the payload, and/or rename field names.

includes.title: Included fields
includes.description: The list of field names of fields to include in the payload. Fields that are not listed are removed from the payload. Note that the "Excluded fields" list takes precedence over the "Included fields" list.

excludes.title: Excluded fields
excludes.description: The list of field names of fields to remove from the payload. The "Exclude fields" list takes precedence over the "Included fields" list.

old_name.title: Old field name
old_name.description: The original label of the field that you want to rename in the payload.

new_name.title: New field name
new_name.description: The new name of the field.

oneOf.title: Mask fields
oneOf.description: Mask fields with a valid null value for the field type (for example: 0, false, empty string, etc) or with a replacement value (only for numeric and string field types).

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: The fields in the payload whose original values you want to replace with replacement. If you do not specify a replacement value, the original value is replaced with a valid null value for the field type (for example: 0, false, empty string, etc).

replacement.title: Replacement
replacement.description: When set, the values of the specified fields are replaced with this value which will be converted to the correct type. If no replacement value is specified, values are replaced with a valid null value for the field type (for example: 0, false, empty string, etc).

oneOf.title: Extract field
oneOf.description: Extract a field from the message's key or value payload and replace the whole key or value with the value of the extracted field.

field.title: Field to extract
field.description: The name of the field to extract from the payload and whose value replaces the entire key or value.

oneOf.title: Message key from fields
oneOf.description: Replace the message key with one or more fields from the message's value payload.

fields.title: Fields for new key
fields.description: Name(s) of the field(s) in the payload to be used to replace the original message key.

oneOf.title: Simple Debezium Topic Router (not enforcing message key uniqueness)
oneOf.description: Simple Debezium Topic Router for sending change events from multiple physical tables to a specified Kafka topic. The router does not enforce message key uniqueness. See: Topic Routing section in the Debezium docs.

topic_regex.title: Input topic regex
topic_regex.description: A regular expression that evaluates the original destination topic name of each message that the connector emits to determine whether to route it to an alternate destination topic. The expression captures one or more groups of characters to apply in output_topic.

output_topic.title: Output topic
output_topic.description: A string that defines the destination topic name. The destination topic name can be static or dynamic. To define dynamic destination topic name(s) use the capture groups matched from topic_regex.

oneOf.title: Unique Key Debezium Topic Router (enforcing message key uniqueness)
oneOf.description: Debezium Topic Router for sending change events from multiple physical tables to a specified Kafka topic. The router enforces message key uniqueness. See: Topic Routing section in the Debezium docs.

topic_regex.title: Input topic regex
topic_regex.description: A regular expression on the original destination topic name of each message that determines if it should be routed to a another destination topic and captures one or more groups of characters to be applied in output_topic

output_topic.title: Output topic
output_topic.description: A string that defines the destination topic name. The destination topic name can be static or dynamic. To define dynamic destination topic name(s) use the capture groups matched from topic_regex.

key_field_name.title: Key field name
key_field_name.description: Specifies the name of the field to add to the message key. The field value identifies the name of the source table, based on the original destination topic name. Optionally, you can manipulate the key field by setting the key_field_topic_regex and key_field_value.

key_field_topic_regex.title: Key field topic regex
key_field_topic_regex.description: A regular expression that is applied to the original destination topic name to capture one or more groups of characters and then apply them in key_field_value

key_field_value.title: Key field value
key_field_value.description: A regular expression replacement string that sets the value of the inserted key field based on the captured groups from key_field_topic_regex.

oneOf.title: Convert to upsert record (extract new record state)
oneOf.description: Convert the complex Debezium data format into a flat upsert record. This transformation will remove the Debezium "envelope" with its metadata from the message and will only keep the updated dataset/row.

delete_handling_mode.title: Handle DELETE events
delete_handling_mode.description: When set to "tombstone" for each DELETE operation a tombstone record will be send to Kafka. When set to "drop" DELETE event records will be removed from the stream and not send to Kafka.

add_metadata_to_value.title: Add Debezium metadata to the Kafka message value
add_metadata_to_value.description: Optionally select Debezium metadata that should be added to the Kafka message value as additional fields of the payload.

add_metadata_to_headers.title: Add Debezium metadata to Kafka message headers
add_metadata_to_headers.description: Optionally select Debezium metadata that should be added to the Kafka message headers as additional header fields.

insert_field_name.title: Field name
insert_field_name.description: The name of the field to insert. Append the suffix ! for a required field, or ? for an optional field.

apply_to.title: Apply to
apply_to.description: Apply transformation to Kafka message key or message value.

debezium_metadata_prefix.title: Metadata field name prefix
debezium_metadata_prefix.description: Optional prefix for the added Debezium metadata fields.
